intro: Mapouria tenuis, commonly known as the slender mapouria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and a tubular corolla. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
